abstractText: In the above article [1], we proposed an automated process for the atrial wall thickness (AWT) measurement method including Poisson-based boundary detection, which is an extension of the previous study [2] that proposed the AWT method using the Laplace’s equation. Unfortunately, we accidently omitted citing our previous work in the part of describing the Laplace-based AWT measurement research. Therefore, our previous article [2] should be additionally cited in the following sentence of the introduction: ‘‘Although the WT measurements have evolved . . . to Laplace-based solutions [14].’’ In addition, the following sentence explaining the source function of Poisson’s equation should be appended to the function description in (1): ‘‘The domain is the voxel domain, and the source function f of Poisson’s equation is defined by the equation: f = σ (x, y, z), where σ is −0.01 if inside the envelope surface and zero otherwise.’’

references.title: Three-dimensional atrial wall thickness measurement algorithm from a segmented atrial wall using a partial differential equation
Accuracy and clinical feasibility of 3D-myocardial thickness map measured by cardiac computed tomogram
references.venue: Int. J. Arrhythmia, vol. 21, no. 1, p. 12, Dec. 2020, doi: 10.1186/s42444-020-00020-w. 15314 This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 License. For more information, see https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/ VOLUME 11, 2023

sections.heading: Segmented Atrial Wall Using a Partial
OH-SEOK KWON 1, JISU LEE1, JE-WOOK PARK1, SO-HYUN YANG1, INSEOK HWANG1, HEE TAE YU1, HANGSIK SHIN 2, (Member, IEEE), AND HUI-NAM PAK 1
sections.text:
1Yonsei University College of Medicine, Yonsei University Health System, Seoul 03722, Republic of Korea 2Department of Convergence Medicine, Asan Medical Center, University of Ulsan College of Medicine, Seoul 05505, Republic of Korea
Corresponding authors: Hangsik Shin (hangsik.shin@amc.seoul.kr) and Hui-Nam Pak (hnpak@yuhs.ac)
This work was supported in part by the Ministry of Health and Welfare under Grant HI21C0011; and in part by the Basic Science Research Program run by the National Research Foundation of Korea (NRF), which is through the Ministry of Science, ICT and Future Planning (MSIP), under Grant NRF-2020R1A2B5B01001695.
This work involved human subjects in its research. Approval of all ethical and experimental procedures and protocols was granted by the Institutional Review Board of Yonsei University Health System (ClinicalTrials.gov) under Approval No. NCT 02138695, and performed in line with the 2013 Declaration of Helsinki.
In the above article [1], we proposed an automated process for the atrial wall thickness (AWT) measurement method including Poisson-based boundary detection, which is an extension of the previous study [2] that proposed the AWT method using the Laplace’s equation. Unfortunately, we accidently omitted citing our previous work in the part of describing the Laplace-based AWT measurement research. Therefore, our previous article [2] should be additionally cited in the following sentence of the introduction: ‘‘Although the WT measurements have evolved . . . to Laplace-based solutions [14].’’
In addition, the following sentence explaining the source function of Poisson’s equation should be appended to the function description in (1): ‘‘The domain is the voxel
domain, and the source function f of Poisson’s equation is defined by the equation: f = σ (x, y, z), where σ is −0.01 if inside the envelope surface and zero otherwise.’’
REFERENCES [1] O.-S. Kwon, J. Lee, J.-W. Park, S.-H. Yang, I. Hwang, H. T. Yu,
H. Shin, and H.-N. Pak, ‘‘Three-dimensional atrial wall thickness measurement algorithm from a segmented atrial wall using a partial differential equation,’’ IEEE Access, vol. 10, pp. 32161–32170, 2022, doi: 10.1109/ACCESS.2022.3159795. [2] O.-S. Kwon, J. Lee, S. Lim, J.-W. Park, H.-J. Han, S.-H. Yang, I. Hwang, H. T. Yu, T.-H. Kim, J.-S. Uhm, B. Joung, M.-H. Lee, and H.-N. Pak, ‘‘Accuracy and clinical feasibility of 3D-myocardial thickness map measured by cardiac computed tomogram,’’ Int. J. Arrhythmia, vol. 21, no. 1, p. 12, Dec. 2020, doi: 10.1186/s42444-020-00020-w.

title: Corrections to ‘‘Three-Dimensional Atrial Wall Thickness Measurement Algorithm From a Segmented Atrial Wall Using a Partial Differential Equation’’
